result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek RH Neuy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

To be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 15, 2022 and each 15th of the month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Time served.With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

for Payment of Fees for Attorney Michelle Wenninger $195.00

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Derek RH Neuy in court.  Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Derek RH Neuy.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Guilty plea entered. Court finds def guilty and enters judgment.  Defendant makes statements.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Derek RH Neuy appeared by video, in custody from WC Jail.  Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Court appoints Atty Michelle Wenninger.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 11-1-2022.  State requests $300.00 cash bond.  Court orders $1,500.00 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:45 am.
